issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: Potential resource leak in JavaKeyStoreProvider due to unclosed stream

comments.body:
Good catch, [~ted_yu]. 
The close calls should actually be done inside of a finally block.
This will likely also be an issue in the credential provider as well.
Fixed to use org.apache.hadoop.io.IOUtils.closeStream(is) in finally blocks.
As [~lmccay] mentioned, org.apache.hadoop.security.alias.JavaKeyStoreProvider also has the same issue. Revised a patch to fix it.
Good catch, [~ted_yu]. I'll update it soon.
Updated to close streams in keyStore.load(fs.open(p), password).

Hi [~ozawa], thank you for the patch. Would you mind import "org.apache.hadoop.io.IOUtils" in the beginning of this file and replace "org.apache.hadoop.io.IOUtils.closeStream(out)" with "IOUtils.closeStream(out)".
Hi [~airbots], thanks for your review. it's fully qualified because both of JavaKeyStoreProvider import org.apache.commons.io.IOUtils.
[~vinayrpet], could you take a look?
Attaching a new patch to use try-with-resources statement instead of closeStream.

The test failure looks not related.

[~cmccabe], could you take a look?

Thank you, Harsh! Sure, committing this shortly.
Committed this to trunk, branch-2, and branch-2.7. Thanks [~ted_yu], [~airbots], and [~qwertymaniac] for your reviews!
